body:
### Problem

With the revision 0.7.2, I had no issue when executing this command : 
:tag btauif

With the revision 0.9.1, nvim tells me that the btauif tag does not exist when executing the same command

Please find attached the .tags file which is used in my project...

I can provide you with the .tags file so that you can check the issue in your side...

### Steps to reproduce

:tag btauif

### Expected behavior

nvim should find the tag as it is present in the .tags file, and it works perfectly with the nvim version 0.7.2

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.1 Build type: Release

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Not checked

### Operating system/version

CentOs 7.0

### Terminal name/version

NA

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

appimage

comment_data.body: [tags_file_issue_24255.zip](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/11954712/tags_file_issue_24255.zip)

In the .vimrc, I've got this setting:
set tags=~/.tags
can you bisect? building Nvim is very easy: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Building-Neovim#build-prerequisites

Hi 

I'm trying to compile nvim from sratch with : 
- git clone https://github.com/neovim/neovim
- cd neovim
- make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
Unfortunately, the compilation has issues with some dependencies (tar files to be downloaded, and that can't be found)
1:LIBUV_URL https://github.com/libuv/libuv/archive/v1.46.0.tar.gz
7:LUAJIT_URL https://github.com/LuaJIT/LuaJIT/archive/51fb2f2c3af778f03258fccee9092401ee4a0215.tar.gz
13:UNIBILIUM_URL https://github.com/neovim/unibilium/archive/d72c3598e7ac5d1ebf86ee268b8b4ed95c0fa628.tar.gz
22:LUV_URL https://github.com/luvit/luv/archive/1.45.0-0.tar.gz
28:LUA_COMPAT53_URL https://github.com/keplerproject/lua-compat-5.3/archive/v0.9.tar.gz
47:TREESITTER_C_URL https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-c/archive/v0.20.2.tar.gz
49:TREESITTER_LUA_URL https://github.com/MunifTanjim/tree-sitter-lua/archive/v0.0.18.tar.gz
51:TREESITTER_VIM_URL https://github.com/neovim/tree-sitter-vim/archive/v0.3.0.tar.gz
53:TREESITTER_VIMDOC_URL https://github.com/neovim/tree-sitter-vimdoc/archive/v2.0.1.tar.gz
55:TREESITTER_QUERY_URL https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/tree-sitter-query/archive/v0.1.0.tar.gz
57:TREESITTER_PYTHON_URL https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-python/archive/36f9e33d52b7572536ac1a8af8d7e78363ad52c3.tar.gz
59:TREESITTER_BASH_URL https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-bash/archive/493646764e7ad61ce63ce3b8c59ebeb37f71b841.tar.gz
61:TREESITTER_MARKDOWN_URL https://github.com/MDeiml/tree-sitter-markdown/archive/936cc84289f6de83c263ae8e659fb342867ceb16.tar.gz
63:TREESITTER_URL https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/archive/91e4d940169a0c0b024560632ef53c4f119117ca.tar.gz

Any idea ?

Check your network (proxy) settings. If you can't compile from source due to restrictive firewall settings, at least test the release appimages for all versions between 0.7.2 and 0.9.1 and tell us which release first showed the issue.

>  make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo

just `make` will be faster (defaults to "debug" build type)

Hi 
I've just test the stable releases (nvimapp images):
- 0.7.0 : OK
- 0.7.2 : OK
- 0.8.0 : can not execute on my CentOs 7.0 machine
./nvim.0.8.0/bin/nvim: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.28' not found (required by ./nvim.0.8.0/bin/nvim)
./nvim.0.8.0/bin/nvim: /lib64/libm.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.29' not found (required by ./nvim.0.8.0/bin/nvim)
- 0.8.1 : Fail
- After 0.8.1 : Fail
Please check with `vim` (as recent as possible). Don't want to spend time on this if it's a vim bug.
Vim patches that touch tag.c between v0.7.0 and v0.8.0 only contain cosmetic changes, so it is unlikely to come from Vim.
I will be checking on my personal laptop tonight, as this is complicated to check on my professional laptop (proxy issues,...)
I've compiled vim from sources and tried it. It is ok with vim
Also keep in mind that lsp sets tagfunc automatically, so it might not use the tags file. Minimal reproduction steps would help rule out stuff like that
Definitely. Did you repro it with `nvim --clean` ?
Using nvim --clean makes no difference
Is it still not possible to bisect?

Hi

What do you mean by "bisect" ? Is it a request for me or for Justin ?
See `git bisect --help`
@narcisse82 I am asking you to build nvim and find the commit that caused the issue, because this is a very specific issue to your files. No one else can do it for you.

Hi Justin,

I've compiled nvim at different tags on my personal laptop, but I can't manage to reproduce the issue I have on my professional laptop.
For the time being, I can not investigate further.
I propose that you close this ticket...

Best regards,
Stephane
This has been closed since a request for information has not been answered for 30 days. It can be reopened when the requested information is provided.

labels.description: waiting for reply from the author
labels.name: needs:response

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)
labels.name: bug-regression

title: :tag fails to find tag since Nvim 0.8
